definition: lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
cheek/lower cheek/chin/jaw/to nourish
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger

sentences.english: You can't ride the tiger forever.
sentences.chinese: 你不能總是對人頤指氣使的。

sentences.english: You mean she bosses her husband around?
sentences.chinese: 你是說她對她的丈夫頤指氣使？

sentences.english: E. g. (1)He broke up with his girlfriend because he got tired of putting up with her demands .
sentences.chinese: 他和女朋友分手了，因爲他厭倦了忍受她的頤指氣使。

sentences.english: I can't stand being bossed around by the manager.
sentences.chinese: 我受不了經理的頤指氣使。

sentences.english: He compared the situation to a marriage in which the wife was bossing around her henpecked husband.
sentences.chinese: 他將之比作婚姻關係，妻子頤指氣使而丈夫唯唯諾諾。

definition: scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
scoundrel/rogue/bully/villain
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
traitor
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
imperious/peremptory
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
political enemy/opponent
harmful teachings/evil doctrine
to share the booty/to divide ill-gotten gains
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
fight to the death/desperate struggle
